meanings.sent1: The scientists studied the fissionable material to understand its properties.
meanings.sent2: The reactor required fissionable elements to generate energy.
meanings.sent3: The fissionable atoms decided to split up and have a party.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a fissionable core, ready to explode with ideas.
meanings.sent5: The glowing fissionable substance hummed with potential energy.

meanings.definition: Able to split into smaller parts.
meanings.sent1: The toy was made of fissionable blocks that could be separated easily.
meanings.sent2: The cake was fissionable into individual slices for the guests.
meanings.sent3: The fissionable puzzle pieces seemed to enjoy being apart.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt fissionable, breaking into fragments with each disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The fragile vase was fissionable, shattering into pieces at the slightest touch.
